required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multiparas Attitude to Outpatient Cesarean Section
clinical_study.official_title: Multiparas Attitude to Outpatient Care After Cesarean Section - A Qualitative Study

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to explore multiparas attitude to outpatient care after a planned cesarean section.

detailed_description.textblock:
This qualitative study should provide information about:
- Multiparas reflections in relation to prefer inpatient care after a planned cesarean section
- Womens anticipation of having inpatient care after cesarean section
- The womens experiences in relation to a planned cesarean birth and the first postnatal weeks

primary_outcome.measure: womens attitude an reflections about based on interviews

other_outcome.description: this study is based on 20 interviews with 10 multiparas having a planned cesarean section. The first interview is performed about one month before term and the second interview about two weeks after the cesarean section.

arm_group.description: Multiparas having a planned cesarean section at the departement of Obstetrics and Gynecology in Herning Hospital. Uncomplicated pregnancy that makes early discharge possible.

study_pop.textblock: Mulitparas having a planned cesarean section at the department of Obstetrics and Gynecology at Herning Hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Planned elective cesarean section of multiparous women
- Singleton pregnancy
- Age of at least 18
- Gestational age between 37 and 42 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
- Lack of consent
- Women with no or little understanding of Danish and ability to speak Danish.
- Allergies to medicine included in the pain management regimes
- Expected maternal or neonatal complications after delivery
- Birth weight of less than 2500 grams

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology, Herning Hospital
